title: Stocks slip on impeachment uncertainty
text:
The release of a whistleblower report that set off the drive to impeach President Donald Trump pressured stocks Thursday. But positive trade comments from China's top diplomat helped curb the losses. The S&P 500 lost a quarter percent. It and the Nasdaq fell for the fourth time in five days.

Nasdaq IR Intelligence senior analyst Massud Ghaussy:

SOUNDBITE: NASDAQ IR INTELLIGENCE SENIOR ANALYST MASSUD GHAUSSY (ENGLISH) SAYING:

"I think investors are just nervous. There's no catalyst currently. It's a lot of the similar themes that are being played out. So the extent that there is no catalyst, markets will continue to trade flat."

Shares of Peloton Interactive tumbled on their debut on the Nasdaq. The fitness startup known for its on-demand bike exercize programs raised $1.2 billion.

By contrast, shares of one of this year's most successful IPOs, Beyond Meat, bolted even higher. McDonald's will test what it calls its "P.L.T." sandwich - which stands for plant, lettuce, tomato. It'll use vegan patties made by Beyond Meat.

Facebook slipped. A source tells Reuters the Justice Department will launch an antitrust probe of the social media company. The social networking company already faces investigations by the Federal Trade Commission, a group of state attorneys general and the House Judiciary Committee.

The release of a whistleblower report that set off the drive to impeach President Donald Trump pressured stocks Thursday. But positive trade comments from China's top diplomat helped curb the losses. The S&P 500 lost a quarter percent. It and the Nasdaq fell for the fourth time in five days. 
              Nasdaq IR Intelligence senior analyst Massud Ghaussy: 
              SOUNDBITE: NASDAQ IR INTELLIGENCE SENIOR ANALYST MASSUD GHAUSSY (ENGLISH) SAYING: 
                 "I think investors are just nervous. There's no catalyst currently. It's a lot of the similar themes that are being played out. So the extent that there is no catalyst, markets will continue to trade flat." 
              Shares of Peloton Interactive tumbled on their debut on the Nasdaq. The fitness startup known for its on-demand bike exercize programs raised $1.2 billion. 
              By contrast, shares of one of this year's most successful IPOs, Beyond Meat, bolted even higher. McDonald's will test what it calls its "P.L.T." sandwich - which stands for plant, lettuce, tomato. It'll use vegan patties made by Beyond Meat. 
              Facebook slipped. A source tells Reuters the Justice Department will launch an antitrust probe of the social media company. The social networking company already faces investigations by the Federal Trade Commission, a group of state attorneys general and the House Judiciary Committee.
